greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Irregular triangle read by rows where row n lists, in weakly increasing order, the differences between consecutive divisors of n.
example: For example, the divisors of 18 are {1,2,3,6,9,18}, with differences {1,1,3,3,9}, which is row 18.
xref: Same as A193829 with rows sorted in increasing order.
Same as A328025 with rows reversed.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Oct 02 2019
